text: Chalmers William "Bump" Elliott (January 30, 1925 – December 7, 2019) was an American football player, coach, and college athletics administrator. He was born in Detroit, Michigan and raised in Bloomington, Illinois. He played halfback at Purdue University (1943–1944) and the University of Michigan (1946–1947). Elliott spent ten years as an assistant football coach at Oregon State, Iowa, and Michigan. He was appointed as Michigan's head football coach in 1959 and held that position until 1968. From 1970 to 1991, he was the athletic director at the University of Iowa. In 1989, Elliott was added into the College Football Hall of Fame. Elliott died on December 7, 2019 in Iowa City, Iowa at the age of 94.Former Michigan Football Coach Passed Away On Saturday ==References== ==Other websites== * Profile at Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan Athletics History * Category:1925 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American football running backs Category:American football coaches Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Sportspeople from Detroit Category:Sportspeople from Illinois Category:Sportspeople from Iowa Category:People from Iowa City, Iowa Category:People from Bloomington, Illinois
title: Bump Elliott
